properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 20 at 2:53PM PST until January 21 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Tidal overflow flooding expected. Tide of 10.05 feet with
a 1.20 anomaly at Toke Point is expected at 10 AM for a total
tide of 11.25

* WHERE...Low lying areas of the south Washington coast.

* WHEN...Around From 9 AM to 11 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level,
during the 10 AM high tide is expected in the low lying areas
near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Similar conditions in the past have
resulted in minor flooding in Raymond and on HWY 101 near South
Bend.
properties.instruction:
A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is
expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert
for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and
property.

NWSheadline: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 11 AM PST TUESDAY
